business.headline: Mid-segment housing: Is it the real core of India's property boom?After years of luxury-led projects, India's real estate developers are refocusing on the mid-segment — a market driven by young professionals, dual-income families, and first-time buyers. But is this segment truly the backbone of India's property boom?

The 'missing' Indian-origin CEO behind Rs 4,200 crore BlackRock loan fraudBankim Brahmbhatt, the Indian-origin CEO of a US-based telecom company, is facing a lawsuit in the US filed by HPS, the private credit investment arm of BlackRock.
Gold and silver shine again after slow start. Will they continue to rise?After a dull opening, both gold and silver managed to regain some shine during the day. Will the upward trend continue?

CBI links Anil Ambani, Rana Kapoor in Rs 2,796-crore Yes Bank loss caseThe CBI has accused industrialist Anil Ambani of approving favours to Yes Bank founder Rana Kapoor's family, causing huge financial losses to the bank. This development highlights alleged corruption and risky investments linked to Ambani's companies.

BlackRock-backed firm accuses Indian-origin entrepreneur of $500 million fraudA US-based telecom entrepreneur of Indian origin, Bankim Brahmbhatt, has been accused of orchestrating a USD 500 million loan fraud involving BlackRock-backed lender HPS Investment Partners.

Sensex, Nifty continue losing streak amid profit booking; BEL jumps 4%The S&P BSE Sensex closed 465.75 points lower at 83,938.71, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 155.75 points to 25,722.10. Selling pressure was broad-based, with most sectoral indices ending in the red.

Lenskart IPO crosses full subscription on Day 1; QIBs drive demandThe IPO opened today and closes on November 4. Lenskart has set a price band of Rs 382 to Rs 402 per share, with a lot size of 37 shares for retail bidders.

Gen Z leads India's crypto investments in Q3 2025: ReportThe 18–25 age group has officially overtaken the 26–35 bracket as the most active investors in crypto. For them, digital assets are no longer a risky experiment — they're becoming part of a serious investment plan.

From Groww to ICICI AMC: Key IPOs to watch this November 2025Bengaluru-based investing platform Groww is set to launch its IPO worth Rs 6,632.3 crore. The issue includes a fresh issue of Rs 1,060 crore and an offer for sale of Rs 5,572.3 crore.

Buying your first house? Check the 5x annual income rule and avoid EMI trapA rising number of first-time buyers are running the affordability math more cautiously. From the 5X income rule to avoiding EMI strain, housing decisions are shifting toward sustainability rather than stretch.

HNI India rebrands as Kokuyo Workplace India, targets leadership in Asia by 2030The rebranding marks a key step in Kokuyo's plan to make India a central hub for its Asia-Pacific operations. The move comes after Kokuyo's acquisition of HNI India earlier this year.

Employees unpaid, control slipping: Bira 91's bad hangoverThe taps are dry, employees unpaid, and investors have taken charge. The question isn't how Bira 91 got here anymore. It's whether it can get out.

Gold loan vs gold overdraft: Which one truly saves you money?Gold loans and gold overdrafts both help unlock the value of your jewellery when you need cash fast. But they don't work the same way — and one could quietly cost you more than you think.

From Aadhaar to bank rules: 7 key financial changes starting November 1As November begins, a fresh set of financial rules will come into effect that could impact your daily money matters. From Aadhaar updates and bank nomination changes to new GST slabs and card fees — here's a quick look at what's changing from November 1.

Air India seeks Rs 10,000 crore lifeline from Tata, SIA after crash: ReportThe request comes at a sensitive moment for the airline, which has been trying to rebuild its reputation, modernise its ageing fleet and streamline operations since being taken over by the Tata Group in 2022.

Meta plans record $30 billion bond sale to stay ahead in AI rcaseThe move comes as Meta signals that its capital expenditure in 2026 will be "notably larger" than next year, underscoring how aggressively it is investing to stay ahead in the AI race.

Lenskart IPO opens: Check GMP, price band, and should you apply?The total issue size is about Rs 7,278 crore, of which roughly Rs 2,150 crore is a fresh issue, while the rest is an offer for sale by existing shareholders.

Gold prices shaky, silver steady. What next for precious metals?Gold is wobbling as the dollar strengthens, while silver holds firm on industrial demand cues. With central banks still buying and the Fed unpredictable, where do precious metals go next?

Sensex, Nifty open flat in volatile trade; NTPC, Cipla among top losersAt around 9:24 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was up just 21.15 points at 84,425.61, while the NSE Nifty50 edged higher by 7.35 points to 25,885.20. Broader market indices also hovered marginally higher, mirroring the lack of conviction at the headline level.

entertainment.headline: SRK's Mannat fan meet cancelled: Will miss seeing you more than you will, he says Shah Rukh Khan skipped his 60th birthday fan meet in Bandra after being advised by authorities due to safety concerns. The actor apologised on X, saying he would miss seeing his fans, continuing a long-held tradition of greeting them outside Mannat every year.

Tobey Maguire's Spider-Man 4 comeback? Writer drops a major hint Comments from screenwriter Mattson Tomlin have sparked discussion among 'Spider-Man' fans regarding the potential return of Tobey Maguire in a new film, although no official confirmation has been given.

Mahesh Babu-Rajamouli's Globetrotter glimpse on OTT soon: When and where to watch Filmmaker SS Rajamouli's upcoming film featuring Mahesh Babu and Priyanka Chopra Jonas will have its first-look teaser launch on November 15 in Hyderabad, with the event streamed live on OTT platforms.

Pankaj Tripathi's mother Hemwanti Devi dies at 89 in Bihar Hemwanti Devi, mother of actor Pankaj Tripathi, died peacefully at her home in Belsand, Gopalganj, Bihar, on October 31. The family has requested privacy as they mourn her loss.

Suhana Khan's adorable King and King's princess post for SRK's 60th birthday Shah Rukh Khan celebrated his 60th birthday with heartfelt wishes from fans and celebrities. Daughter Suhana Khan's adorable post featuring "King" and "King's princess" mugs went viral.

Varun Tej-Lavanya celebrate 2nd anniversary with son Vaayuv's cute glimpse On their second wedding anniversary, actors Varun Tej and Lavanya Tripathi shared personal celebrations and photos featuring their baby boy, Vaayuv, giving followers a look into their family life.

Fans react to SRK's King title reveal, call him Boss of Bollywood Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming film 'King' has generated significant excitement after the release of its teaser, with fans and audiences reacting enthusiastically online to the actor's latest on-screen transformation and the film's dramatic tone.

SRK turns 60: Akshay Kumar to Shilpa Shetty, celebs celebrate superstar's legacy Several celebrities poured in their love for Shah Rukh Khan on his 60th birthday today. They wrote heartfelt messages and celebrated the superstar's legacy.

Shah Bano's family files plea to halt Yami Gautam, Emraan Hashmi's HAQ Shah Bano's family has reportedly filed a petition in Indore High Court seeking an immediate stay on the release of Yami Gautam and Emraan Hashmi's 'HAQ'.

Bigg Boss Tamil 9: Kalai evicted, Vijay Sethupathi schools housemates In the latest episode of 'Bigg Boss Tamil 9', host Vijay Sethupathi schooled the contestant and discussed how the show has become unwatchable because of everyone's behaviour.

King title out: SRK's fiery and ruthless avatar on his 60th birthday Shah Rukh Khan fans are rejoicing as director Siddharth Anand unveiled the title announcement video of their upcoming film 'King' on the superstar's 60th birthday. The movie is set to release in theatres in 2026.

Operation Safed Sagar teaser: Siddharth, Jimmy Shergill bring Kargil war to life The teaser of Netflix's upcoming series 'Operation Safed Sagar' was released on November 2. The show is a key mission carried out by the Indian Air Force (IAF) during the 1999 Kargil War.

BB19 Episode 70: Ashnoor opens up on body-image struggles, says she starved herself In the latest episode of 'Bigg Boss 19's' Weekend Ka Vaar, Salman Khan addressed body-shaming comments made on Ashnoor Kaur and a contentious statement involving Sidharth Shukla. Singing siblings Neha Kakkar and Tony Kakkar also appeared on the show as special guests.

SRK's 60th bash in Alibaug: Farah Khan shares pics, KJo and Rani Mukerji attend Shah Rukh Khan marked his 60th birthday in Alibaug surrounded by friends and family, as colleagues shared glimpses from the celebration. Farah Khan and Karan Johar, among others, shared pictures from the party.

Hrithik Roshan celebrates Saba Azad's 40th birthday with love, poetry and memories Actor Hrithik Roshan shared a series of photos and a poem on social media to celebrate Saba Azad's 40th birthday, offering fans a glimpse into their relationship.

SRK turns 60: Fans from the world over at Mannat for a glimpse in early hours Shah Rukh Khan fans gathered outside his bungalow Mannat in the early hours of his birthday, November 2, 2025, for a glimpse of the superstar.

Happy Birthday SRK: Why the superstar remains Gen Z's favourite loverboy at 60 Gen Z is rediscovering Shah Rukh Khan's classic romantic films, finding comfort and charm in his timeless love stories. From OTT to theatre re-releases, young viewers are celebrating SRK's old-school romance with fresh enthusiasm.

Mahesh Babu, Priyanka Chopra and SS Rajamouli tease fans with SSMB 29 hints Actors Mahesh Babu, Priyanka Chopra, and director SS Rajamouli stirred up curiosity among fans on Saturday with a lively social media conversation about their upcoming film 'SSMB 29'. The team confirmed that an update on the film will be released on November 2.

Shah Rukh Khan plans special fan meet in Bandra for 60th birthday Shah Rukh Khan will hold a special gathering for his fans on November 2 at Balgandharva Rangmandir in Mumbai's Bandra. The event will only be open to those holding passes distributed through his fan clubs.

general news.headline: Both Pak, Congress yet to recover from Op Sindoor: PM attacks Opposition in BiharPM Modi accused Congress' 'royal family' of losing sleep over blasts in Pakistan, saying both Pakistan and Congress' naamdars are yet to recover from Operation Sindoor.

Isro launches heaviest satellite to boost Navy's communication gridUnlike its ageing predecessor GSAT-7 "Rukmini," CMS-03 offers significantly expanded coverage and bandwidth, ensuring real-time connectivity even in remote or contested ocean zones.​

SRK's Mannat fan meet cancelled: Will miss seeing you more than you will, he saysShah Rukh Khan skipped his 60th birthday fan meet in Bandra after being advised by authorities due to safety concerns. The actor apologised on X, saying he would miss seeing his fans, continuing a long-held tradition of greeting them outside Mannat every year.

18 dead, 3 injured as traveller rams parked truck in JodhpurEighteen people were killed and three others injured when a speeding tempo traveller rammed into a parked truck on the Bharat Mala Expressway in Rajasthan's Jodhpur district on Sunday night.

I gave Rs 38 lakh to scammers: Chef investing for daughter's studies shares storyJust a Facebook like by Chef Sumit Kumar got him defrauded of Rs 38 lakh in an investment impersonation scam. Such scams have resulted in 30,000 people across major cities in India losing over Rs 1,500 crore in the last 6 months. Here's why people willingly hand over their hard-earned money to scammers, and how the cash becomes untraceable.

India needs to grow thicker skin: Shashi Tharoor slams deporting Hindi scholarShashi Tharoor criticised India for deporting Hindi scholar Francesca Orsini, warning that such actions harm the nation's global image and urging greater openness to foreign academics.

India level T20I series as Arshdeep, Sundar shine in 5-wicket win over AustraliaAUS vs IND, 3rd T20I: Arshdeep Singh's fiery comeback and Washington Sundar's late cameo powered India to a five-wicket win over Australia in Hobart, levelling the T20I series 1-1.

Wide awake at 11 pm? Blame the Second Wind EffectIf you are feeling a sudden burst of energy after a long day and right before going to bed, it does not mean you should "make the most of it." Experts call it the second wind phenomenon and here's what you should know about it.

Vreels: A Game-Changing Platform Pushing Social Media Beyond TikTok and InstagramVreels isn't just about sharing, it's about connecting meaningfully. Through built-in chat, voice, and video call features, users can communicate without leaving the app.

Girl, 9, jumps to death at Jaipur school; cops say bloodstains at scene wipedA 9-year-old girl died after allegedly jumping from the fourth floor of Jaipur's Neerja Modi School. Her parents and a parents' association have accused the school of harassment and evidence tampering.

PM does yoga for votes, Adani and Ambani dance after polls: Rahul Gandhi's digAddressing a rally in Bihar's Begusarai, Congress MP Rahul Gandhi claimed PM Narendra Modi does not listen to the people and "vanishes" after elections.

Blinkit customer recalls delivery agent arriving in tears over deduction after complaintIn a now-viral post on Reddit, a user recalled how a Blinkit delivery agent arrived at their door in tears after a missing-item complaint led to a deduction from his earnings.

Synonymous with excellence: PM's big praise for Isro on heaviest satellite launchCongratulating the space agency, PM Modi claimed that the successful launch of Bahubali would ensure national progress, and it would empower countless lives.
India did a big test in space after LVM3 launch, Isro chief revealsThis breakthrough shows Isro's advancing technological prowess, particularly in enhancing space mission precision and efficiency.

India's teachers are burning out, and students are paying the priceTeachers carry emotional and academic load round the clock, leading to burnout that affects classrooms and student wellbeing. Experts say student mental health cannot improve without supporting teachers and involving parents. India needs better support systems, training, and recognition to protect educators.

Portfolios of murder, kidnapping will be distributed if RJD wins: Amit ShahTaking a sharp jibe at Lalu Prasad Yadav's party and family, the Union Home Minister said that Jungle Raj will return to the state if the Rashtriya Janata Dal-led Mahagathbandhan comes back to power.

Satyamev Jayate: Anant Singh's 1st reaction after arrest in Mokama murder caseAnant Singh was arrested early Sunday in connection with the murder of Dularchand Yadav. His lawyer claims the arrest is politically motivated and aimed at influencing the Mokama elections.

sports.headline: Gambhir-level decision: Team India slammed for sending Amanjot ahead of Richa Ghosh Fans were left stunned after India sent Amanjot Kaur ahead of Richa Ghosh in the Women's World Cup final against South Africa. Despite Richa's fiery form, the call baffled many, sparking strong reactions online as India set a 299-run target.

Kuldeep Yadav released from India T20I squad, to feature in South Africa A series Kuldeep Yadav has been released from India's T20I squad against Australia on Sunday, November 2. Kuldeep will join the India A squad for the second four-day match against South Africa A.

I don't chase results, focused on doing what's required of me: Washington Sundar Washington Sundar showcased his growing T20 prowess as India chased down 187 to beat Australia by five wickets at the Ninja Oval. Displaying calm and power, he hit crucial sixes and later said he focuses on enjoying the game rather than chasing results or pressure.

Rohit Sharma at Navi Mumbai stadium with wife Ritika to cheer for India Women's World Cup final: Rohit Sharma was present at DY Patil Stadium to support India women's cricket team.  Rohit was seen watching the final between India and South Africa while seated alongside ICC chairman Jay Shah on Sunday, November 2.

Harmanpreet Kaur scripts record for most runs in Women's ODI World Cup knockouts Harmanpreet Kaur broke the record for the most runs scored in Women's ODI World Cup knockouts during the 2025 edition final between India and South Africa at the DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai on Sunday.

Focused on execution: Arshdeep reflects on POTM show vs Australia in Hobart Australia vs India: After winning the Player of the Match award in his T20I comeback, Arshdeep Singh said he has been focusing on clarity and consistency rather than chasing results.

Women's World Cup final: Shafali Verma repays faith by breaking 3-year-old duck Shafali Verma repaid the faith of the team management and the selection committee by breaking her fifty duck in the final of the Women's World Cup 2025.

IND-W vs SA-W: Smriti Mandhana makes history, shatters Mithali Raj's World Cup record Smriti Mandhana has entered the record books with a stunning knock in the World Cup final against South Africa. Her tally of 416 runs is now the highest by an Indian in a single edition, surpassing Mithali Raj's 2017 mark — and she's not done yet.

Rishabh Pant hits 90 on red-ball comeback, carries India to 3-wicket winRishabh Pant's sparkling 90 formed the backbone of India A's hard-fought three-wicket win over South Africa A in the first four-day match on Sunday at the BCCI Centre of Excellence Grounds.

Women's World Cup: Kanpur fans rally behind Team India ahead of finalAs the Indian women's cricket team prepares for the ICC Women's World Cup final against South Africa, excitement fills the air in Kanpur. Fans gather with flags and chants, expressing their faith in the team's form and spirit.

Heart vs Mind: Gavaskar's tense prediction for India's historic World Cup final vs South AfricaOn this India Today Special Report, the focus is on the Women's Cricket World Cup 2025 final between India and South Africa, with legendary cricketer Sunil Gavaskar sharing his expert analysis. My heart says India, but my mind says to me, you know that, don't forget that the South African men's team won the world championship... so 2025 is a year which has been good for South Africa in cricket,' Gavaskar commented on the tense final. The discussion delves deep into crucial factors like the toss, weather conditions in Navi Mumbai, and the strategic dilemmas facing the Indian team. Gavaskar weighs in on the playing XI, backing the explosive Shafali Verma to open the innings, and analyzes the bowling combination, highlighting the pros and cons of different spinners against a powerful South African batting lineup. The report captures the excitement around a historic final that will crown a first-time world champion.

World Cup Final Drama: Rain Threatens India's Historic Title Clash With South Africa In Navi MumbaiThis special report from India Today focuses on the Women's Cricket World Cup final between India and South Africa at the DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai, where unpredictable weather threatens to disrupt the historic match. A fan on the ground noted, 'The good thing that we have 2 new teams in the final, India and South Africa. Something different than every time we see Australia or England, so. Yes, it is going to be a. Great contest'. The coverage captures the immense excitement among fans, with correspondent Khushi Gupta speaking to locals and the dedicated Bharat Army fan group. Key figures like Indian captain Harmanpreet Kaur and South African star Marizanne Kapp are central to the contest. Despite the looming rain, which has been intermittent, supporters remain hopeful of seeing India clinch its maiden World Cup title on home soil, creating a tense and electrifying atmosphere.

Watch: India stars send heartfelt wishes to team ahead of ODI World Cup final vs SAAs India gear up for the Women's ODI World Cup final against South Africa, their teammates not in the ODI squad made sure to wish the side luck. From Shreyanka Patil to Poonam Yadav, heartfelt wishes poured in for the big night in Navi Mumbai.

IND vs SA Live: India post 298, South Africa need record chaseIndia (IND) vs South Africa (SA) Live Score, Women's World Cup 2025 Final: India have posted a challenging total in Navi Mumbai and the onus is now on the bowlers to get the job done. South Africa will need to secure a record chase to win the title, so the pressure will be on them.

The Super Sunday is hers: A final that could change women's cricket foreverWomen's World Cup final: On a morning when chai stalls hum with talk of Harmanpreet and Smriti instead of Virat and Rohit, India stands at the edge of something rare. Tonight's result may decide not just a title, but the future of women's cricket in India and the world beyond.

We slept on floor: Indian women's team 1st captain recalls struggles of the pastFormer India women's cricket team captain Shantha Rangaswamy recalled the difficult days. She said that the Indian women's team had to earlier sleep on the floor and carry their own bedding.

Fourth time lucky? India's mental battle to end the World Cup heartbreakIndia are all set to play their fourth final of an ICC event as they take on South Africa in the Women's World Cup 2025 final. The Harmanpreet Kaur-led side face a daunting task of rising above their past heartbreaks to taste the World Cup glory.

Harmanpreet Kaur: Moga's daughter one step away from cricketing immortalityIndia vs South Africa, Women's World Cup: Harmanpreet Kaur stands one step away from cricketing immortality as Indian women's cricket chases a watershed moment that could mirror the men's historic 1983 triumph. On Sunday at the DY Patil Stadium, her team will take on a formidable South Africa, determined to end the country's long wait for an ICC trophy.

India vs South Africa, Women's World Cup 2025 Final: Key matchups to look out forIndia and South Africa face off for a maiden World Cup title in Navi Mumbai. Mandhana vs Kapp, Mlaba vs Rodrigues, Richa vs de Klerk — five duels, one night, and a shot at rewriting history.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
